I graduated in 2018 with a degree in mathematics and haven't visited Khan Academy probably since high school, but today my brother (who just entered his freshman year as a student in math as well) came to me needing help with some conceptual questions on calculus. Even though I could still easily solve the problems, the concepts themselves I had completely forgotten, and honestly math stack exchange was not very helpful. Found a Khan Academy video from 11 years ago on epsilon delta proofs and within 4 minutes had grasped the concept to explain to my brother. Sal, thanks for all you've done and do. There are millions of people that watch your content and your influence will span generations. I will happily donate.
Can I tell you thank you! Your channel helped me finish grad 👩‍🎓 school 🏫. I just have a finance course left  and I will graduate. You have saved my life and my career! Thank You for all the lessons!

I feel that Khan Academy changed my life. At first, I just thought that school and studying are just things that we do routinely, and are things that I don't get so excited about. But, when I was introduced to Khan Academy, my feeling towards learning and education changed drastically. I started learning new subjects that weren't in my grade. I started studying and learning, not only for scores and exams, but also for the sake of it. For the sake of learning. I feel that Khan Academy changed my view towards learning, and gave me better motivation for me to learn and study. So, thank you Khan Academy. Thank you Sal. And Thank you to all of Khan Academy's staff and teachers.
May God reward you Sal for all the work done by you. Jazakallah!
Thanks Sal! You've helped us a lot through the pandemic!
You are the best. I have nothing else to say

Thanks Sal! Welcome back Khanacademy. We love to hear from you all the time.

Thank you for the lovely message, Sal. I think some of the most impactful content you can put out this back to school is actually student advice videos, filmed just like this one. Your tips for reducing test stress were tranformational, and I'd love to learn more wisdom from you. In particular, it would be tremendously helpful if you post short advice videos on various dimensions of evidence-based study tips, and some general life advice on living the good life. I also recommend posting excerpts of your answers to study advice questions on the Homeroom Ask Me Anythings, especially your skill of delegating hard concepts to your subconcious and waking up with an insight. Thank you so much for everything. I'm so grateful we have Khan Academy's noble service on this planet, as part of the vast cosmos. (You can see I meditate with your videos regularly.)
I can out teach Sal with my knowledge and personality tied behind by back. It's the reaction to the pandemic that has been tough - the tyranny.
